required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Translation and Development of an Online Self-help Intervention With Subsequent Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Translation and Development of an Online Self-help Intervention With Subsequent Feasibility Study as an After Care After Inpatient Psychosomatic Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the feasibility and effectiveness of an internet-based self help program concerning satisfaction with the treatment and their life, depression and anxiety. Both study groups get access to the internet-based self-help program. The intervention group receives additional feedback to their progress in the program from an online therapist. The investigators hypothesize that (1) at least 75% of the patients in the intervention group are "satisfied" or "very satisfied" with the self-help program, (2) 50% of the patients in the intervention group work with all eight units and (3) patients of the intervention group have a higher emotional competence than the patients of the control group at the end of the self-help program.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of the intervention group with the internet-based self-help program measured with an reworded version of the "patient satisfaction questionnaire" (ZUF-8)

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotional competence measured with the "SEK-27" (questionnaire for self-assessment of emotional competence)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression measured with the German version of the "PHQ-9" (Patient Health Questionnaire)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured with the German version of the "EUROHIS-QOL 8" (European Health Interview Survey Quality of Life 8)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Anxiety measured with the German version of the "GAD-7" (General Anxiety Disorder Screener)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-esteem measured with the German version of the "RSE" (Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Somatoform afflictions measured with the German version of the "SSS-8" (Somatic Symptom Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective prognosis of work ability measured with the "SPE" (Subjective Prognosis of Work Ability)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapeutic alliance measured with the German version of the "WAI-SR" (Working Alliance Inventory - Short Revised)
Depersonalisation measured with the German short version of the "CDS-2" (Cambridge Depersonalisation Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1) and 19 weeks after study inclusion (T2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptance of the internet-based self-help program measured with an especially for the self-help program devised questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of every unit (weekly) and 10 weeks after study inclusion (T1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Usage of the internet-based self-help program measured with an especially for the self-help program devised questionnaire
Utilization of alternative after care measures (psychotherapy and drugs) with a self-devised questionnaire

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm receive access to the internet-based self-help program and get feedback on their progress in the program.
Patients in this arm receive access to the internet-based self-help program and don't get any therapeutic feedback

intervention.description: Access to the internet-based self-help program
Therapeutic feedback on the written information sent to the online therapist

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- day care/ inpatient treatment in the Department of Psychosomatic Medicine and Psychotherapy at the University Medical Center of the Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz
- minimum age of 18 years
- private internet access
- e-mail address
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute suicidality
- psychosis
- current alcohol or drug addiction
- life time diagnosis of a schizophrenic, schizoaffective, bipolar or organic psychic disorder

overall_official.affiliation: Department for Psychosomatic Medicine and Psychotherapy at the University Medical Center of the Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz

facility.name: University Medical Center, Department of Psychosomatic Medicine and Psychotherapy, Johannes Gutenberg University

reference.citation: Zwerenz R, Becker J, Johansson R, Frederick RJ, Andersson G, Beutel ME. Transdiagnostic, Psychodynamic Web-Based Self-Help Intervention Following Inpatient Psychotherapy: Results of a Feasibility Study and Randomized Controlled Trial. JMIR Ment Health. 2017 Oct 16;4(4):e41. doi: 10.2196/mental.7889.
